message.content:
cs.NE, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SI, cs.DS. 

The paper proposes a novel approach for anomaly detection using evolving Spiking Neural Networks, which involves unsupervised learning and online adaptation to changing input data. This work involves machine learning and neural networks, which are typically covered in the cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) and cs.LG (Machine Learning) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper deals with unsupervised learning, which is a common topic in the cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) sub-category. The proposed approach also involves efficient classification and adaptation to changing data, which can be related to the cs.SI (Signal Processing) sub-category. Finally, the experiments involve the use of datasets and performance evaluation, which can be related to the cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) sub-category.
